metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4567 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in LetoDMS (formerly MyDMS) before 3.3.8 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified parameters in (1) inc/inc.ClassUI.php or (2) out/out.DocumentNotify.php.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

letodms - 3.3.9+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: letodms package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.9+dfsg-1').
